info.name: QuranReflect Public APIs (by path)
info.description:
These APIs enables you to programatically access the [QuranReflect](http://www.quranreflect.com) platform . 

The documentation (and the APIs) are a work-in-progress and are managed by a small team including volunteers. Please keep this in mind as you browser our documentation and integrate with your application. 

We strive to provide an API experience that is world-class, and understand there is a long way to get there and we appreciate your feedback and comments along this journey.

# How to use this documentation

Please browse the few sections in the beginning of the topic and then you can select the area youa are interestined in (i.e. User, Post).

Note that the documentation will show `{{baseUrl}}` as the base API URL until you choose an `Environment` from the top-left menu. Once chosen, the environment URL will then be used for all the examples and URLs in the documentation.

# Authentication

### Client Auth Token

In order to use the APIs you will need to send a `client_auth_token` as part of your request. This is usually sent as part of the JSON body of your request. It is a secret key that resembles an API access key and is given to you by the QuranReflect team when you sign up to access our APIs.

Please note that this token is unique per environment, so you will need a different one for staging and production.

### User Auth Token

Furthermore, when sending a request to the API that requires user authentication you will need to provide a collection of items, usually via headers, to authenticate your request. You receive these items when you sign-in a user.

#### Token Expiry

Please note that when you sign-in a user, along with the token information you will get back is an `expiry` header. This dictates the time your token will expire. There is currently no way to refresh a token, so when it expires you need to do another sign-in request to get a fresh token.

# Environments

## Dev/Staging

The URL for the dev/staging envrionment is: http://qreflect.com/v1

WARNING: The dev endpoint only supports HTTP. This will be changed in the future.

## Production

The URL for the dev/staging envrionment is: https://www.quranreflect.com/v1 

Please use HTTPS only to access our APIs. HTTP access will be deprecated soon.

TODO: Disable HTTP on the API endpoint.

# Sample Source Code

You can select a language from the `Language` menu at the top of this page. This will generate sample code for _accessing_ the APIs.

We plan to provide more sample source code that includes a complete workflow (i.e. signing in and loading posts) in a few languages, which will also include custom components built to work around a few of the APIs design limitations.

TODO: Include sample implementations especiallay for search

# Request API Access

To request a `client_auth_token` for API access please [email our team](mailto:support@quranreflect.com) and include the following:

- Your full name and the organization you are associated with
- How do you plan to use the APIs
- Any specific technical details on how the APIs will be accessed (i.e. a backend, or mobile app and what platform)
- If you require any help or guidance from our team in the implementation

Our team will be in touch once they receive your request.

So those whose scales are heavy - it is they who will be the successful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19671, "citation_id": 8, "number": 9, "text": "And those whose scales are light - they are the ones who will lose themselves for what injustice they were doing toward Our verses.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19672, "citation_id": 8, "number": 10, "text": "And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein ways of livelihood. Little are you grateful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19673, "citation_id": 8, "number": 11, "text": "And We have certainly created you, [O Mankind], and given you [human] form. Then We said to the angels, \"Prostrate to Adam\"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was not of those who prostrated.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19674, "citation_id": 8, "number": 12, "text": "[Allah] said, \"What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?\" [Satan] said, \"I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19675, "citation_id": 8, "number": 13, "text": "[Allah] said, \"Descend from Paradise, for it is not for you to be arrogant therein. So get out; indeed, you are of the debased.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19676, "citation_id": 8, "number": 14, "text": "[Satan] said, \"Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19677, "citation_id": 8, "number": 15, "text": "[Allah] said, \"Indeed, you are of those reprieved.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19678, "citation_id": 8, "number": 16, "text": "[Satan] said, \"Because You have put me in error, I will surely sit in wait for them on Your straight path.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19679, "citation_id": 8, "number": 17, "text": "Then I will come to them from before them and from behind them and on their right and on their left, and You will not find most of them grateful [to You].\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19680, "citation_id": 8, "number": 18, "text": "[Allah] said, \"Get out of Paradise, reproached and expelled. He said, \"Your Lord did not forbid you this tree except that you become angels or become of the immortal.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19683, "citation_id": 8, "number": 21, "text": "And he swore [by Allah] to them, \"Indeed, I am to you from among the sincere advisors.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19684, "citation_id": 8, "number": 22, "text": "So he made them fall, through deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And their Lord called to them, \"Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19685, "citation_id": 8, "number": 23, "text": "They said, \"Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19686, "citation_id": 8, "number": 24, "text": "[Allah] said, \"Descend, being to one another enemies. And for you on the earth is a place of settlement and enjoyment for a time.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19687, "citation_id": 8, "number": 25, "text": "He said, \"Therein you will live, and therein you will die, and from it you will be brought forth.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19688, "citation_id": 8, "number": 26, "text": "O children of Adam, We have bestowed upon you clothing to conceal your private parts and as adornment. But the clothing of righteousness - that is best. That is from the signs of Allah that perhaps they will remember.", "translation_id": 5 } ] }, "language": "ENGLISH", "detected_translation": 5, "views": 0, "group": null, "group_link": null, "comments": [], "liked": false, "author": { "id": 4, "username": "amerabbas", "name": "Amer Abbas", "verified": false, "profile_img": "//qreflect-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/events/banner/en/avatars/4/original.?1524576806" }, "filters": [ { "id": 122, "from": 2, "to": 50, "indicator_text": "surah-7-2:50", "chapter": { "id": 8, "name": "Al-A'raaf", "description": null, "number": 7, "parent_id": 1 } } ], "tags": [ { "id": 5, "name": "Zohd" } ] }, { "id": 124, "body": "Random post for Sura At-Tawba", "likes": 0, "draft": false, "published_at": "November 12, 2016 13:46", "room_id": null, "global": true, "editable": false, "deletable": false, "reportable": true, "citation_texts": { "0": [ { "id": 19948, "citation_id": 10, "number": 5, "text": "And when the sacred months have passed, then kill the polytheists wherever you find them and capture them and besiege them and sit in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they should repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, let them [go] on their way. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19949, "citation_id": 10, "number": 6, "text": "And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19950, "citation_id": 10, "number": 7, "text": "How can there be for the polytheists a treaty in the sight of Allah and with His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a treaty at al-Masjid al-Haram? So as long as they are upright toward you, be upright toward them. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19951, "citation_id": 10, "number": 8, "text": "How [can there be a treaty] while, if they gain dominance over you, they do not observe concerning you any pact of kinship or covenant of protection? They satisfy you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse [compliance], and most of them are defiantly disobedient.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19952, "citation_id": 10, "number": 9, "text": "They have exchanged the signs of Allah for a small price and averted [people] from His way. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19953, "citation_id": 10, "number": 10, "text": "They do not observe toward a believer any pact of kinship or covenant of protection. And it is they who are the transgressors.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19954, "citation_id": 10, "number": 11, "text": "But if they repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the verses for a people who know.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19955, "citation_id": 10, "number": 12, "text": "And if they break their oaths after their treaty and defame your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief, for indeed, there are no oaths [sacred] to them; [fight them that] they might cease.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19956, "citation_id": 10, "number": 13, "text": "Would you not fight a people who broke their oaths and determined to expel the Messenger, and they had begun [the attack upon] you the first time? Do you fear them? But Allah has more right that you should fear Him, if you are [truly] believers.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19957, "citation_id": 10, "number": 14, "text": "Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them and satisfy the breasts of a believing people", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19958, "citation_id": 10, "number": 15, "text": "And remove the fury in the believers' hearts. And Allah turns in forgiveness to whom He wills; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19959, "citation_id": 10, "number": 16, "text": "Do you think that you will be left [as you are] while Allah has not yet made evident those among you who strive [for His cause] and do not take other than Allah, His Messenger and the believers as intimates? And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19960, "citation_id": 10, "number": 17, "text": "It is not for the polytheists to maintain the mosques of Allah [while] witnessing against themselves with disbelief. [For] those, their deeds have become worthless, and in the Fire they will abide eternally.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19961, "citation_id": 10, "number": 18, "text": "The mosques of Allah are only to be maintained by those who believe in Allah and the Last Day and establish prayer and give zakah and do not fear except Allah, for it is expected that those will be of the [rightly] guided.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19962, "citation_id": 10, "number": 19, "text": "Have you made the providing of water for the pilgrim and the maintenance of al-Masjid al-Haram equal to [the deeds of] one who believes in Allah and the Last Day and strives in the cause of Allah? They are not equal in the sight of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19963, "citation_id": 10, "number": 20, "text": "The ones who have believed, emigrated and striven in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives are greater in rank in the sight of Allah. And it is those who are the attainers [of success].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19964, "citation_id": 10, "number": 21, "text": "Their Lord gives them good tidings of mercy from Him and approval and of gardens for them wherein is enduring pleasure.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19965, "citation_id": 10, "number": 22, "text": "[They will be] abiding therein forever. Indeed, Allah has with Him a great reward.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19966, "citation_id": 10, "number": 23, "text": "O you who have believed, do not take your fathers or your brothers as allies if they have preferred disbelief over belief. And whoever does so among you - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19967, "citation_id": 10, "number": 24, "text": "Say, [O Muhammad], \"If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your relatives, wealth which you have obtained, commerce wherein you fear decline, and dwellings with which you are pleased are more beloved to you than Allah and His Messenger and jihad in His cause, then wait until Allah executes His command. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19968, "citation_id": 10, "number": 25, "text": "Allah has already given you victory in many regions and [even] on the day of Hunayn, when your great number pleased you, but it did not avail you at all, and the earth was confining for you with its vastness; then you turned back, fleeing.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19969, "citation_id": 10, "number": 26, "text": "Then Allah sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the believers and sent down soldiers angels whom you did not see and punished those who disbelieved. And that is the recompense of the disbelievers.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19970, "citation_id": 10, "number": 27, "text": "Then Allah will accept repentance after that for whom He wills; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19971, "citation_id": 10, "number": 28, "text": "O you who have believed, indeed the polytheists are unclean, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this, their [final] year. And if you fear privation, Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. We have not assigned to any before [this] name.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20966, "citation_id": 20, "number": 8, "text": "He said, \"My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20967, "citation_id": 20, "number": 9, "text": "[An angel] said, \"Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' \"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20968, "citation_id": 20, "number": 10, "text": "[Zechariah] said, \"My Lord, make for me a sign.\" He said, \"Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20969, "citation_id": 20, "number": 11, "text": "So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20970, "citation_id": 20, "number": 12, "text": "[Allah] said, \"O John, take the Scripture with determination.\" And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20971, "citation_id": 20, "number": 13, "text": "And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20972, "citation_id": 20, "number": 14, "text": "And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20973, "citation_id": 20, "number": 15, "text": "And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20974, "citation_id": 20, "number": 16, "text": "And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20975, "citation_id": 20, "number": 17, "text": "And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' \"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 20985, "citation_id": 20, "number": 27, "text": "Then she brought him to her people, carrying him.                     "text": "[It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24087,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 4,
                    "text": "The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24088,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 5,
                    "text": "So be patient with gracious patience.",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24089,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 6,
                    "text": "Indeed, they see it [as] distant,",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24090,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 7,
                    "text": "But We see it [as] near.",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24091,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 8,
                    "text": "On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24092,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 9,
                    "text": "And the mountains will be like wool,",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24093,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 10,
                    "text": "And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24094,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 11,
                    "text": "They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24095,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 12,
                    "text": "And his wife and his brother",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24096,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 13,
                    "text": "And his nearest kindred who shelter him",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24097,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 14,
                    "text": "And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24098,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 15,
                    "text": "No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24099,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 16,
                    "text": "A remover of exteriors.",
                    "translation_id": 5
                },
                {
                    "id": 24100,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 17,
                    "text": "It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]",

                },
                {
                    "id": 24101,
                    "citation_id": 71,

                },
                {

                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 19,
                    "text": "Indeed, mankind was created anxious:",

                },
                {
                    "id": 24103,
                    "citation_id": 71,
                    "number": 20,
                    "text": "When evil touches him, impatient,",

                }

Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.", "translation_id": 5 } ] }, "author": { "id": 28, "username": "abdelrahman", "name": "Abdelrahman", "verified": false, "profile_img": null, "followed": false }, "filters": [ { "id": 242, "from": 50, "to": 50, "indicator_text": null } ], "tags": [] }, { "id": 277, "body": "Focus less on quantity, more on quality: I committed myself to reciting a minimum of one page, but whenever I feel like more Ill do more. I wont repeat my mistake of setting a minimum of one juz per night from the start.\r\nDouble up: I read my wird in the morning and then recite the same verses while praying qiyam. Somehow, repeating the same verses twice a day helped me reflect and ponder on them better.\r\nDraw stars: Here is where the pencil magic kicks in! I drew asterisks in the margins of my mushaf to mark the verses that touched me, whether I applied them to my own life or simply enjoyed their meaning or figurative language. The next time I read those verses, their effect on me was much deeper and reflecting on them (or sometimes just being fascinated by them) was much easier! Furthermore, whenever I reached the same page again, I would add more stars. So the page that started with having one star ended up with three or four; the verses that move my heart have now doubled at least, Alhamdulillah!\r\nLook for themes and patterns: Sometimes a certain surah mentions a lot of blessings, for example, or one of Allahs Most Beautiful Names or attributes are repeated many times. I believe this is done to draw our attention to a certain theme so that we will read all the verses in the context of that theme. Sometimes I find themes for the whole surah and sometimes for a page or a group of verses. but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, \"Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18730, "citation_id": 3, "number": 15, "text": "[But] Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression [while] they wander blindly.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18731, "citation_id": 3, "number": 16, "text": "Those are the ones who have purchased error [in exchange] for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18732, "citation_id": 3, "number": 17, "text": "Their example is that of one who kindled a fire, but when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness [so] they could not see.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18733, "citation_id": 3, "number": 18, "text": "Deaf, dumb and blind - so they will not return [to the right path].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18734, "citation_id": 3, "number": 19, "text": "Or [it is] like a rainstorm from the sky within which is darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18735, "citation_id": 3, "number": 20, "text": "The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights [the way] for them, they walk therein; but when darkness comes over them, they stand [still]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "1": [ { "id": 19002, "citation_id": 4, "number": 1, "text": "Alif, Lam, Meem.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19003, "citation_id": 4, "number": 2, "text": "Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19004, "citation_id": 4, "number": 3, "text": "He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19005, "citation_id": 4, "number": 4, "text": "Before, as guidance for the people. And He revealed the Qur'an. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah will have a severe punishment, and Allah is exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19006, "citation_id": 4, "number": 5, "text": "Indeed, from Allah nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19007, "citation_id": 4, "number": 6, "text": "It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19008, "citation_id": 4, "number": 7, "text": "It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them]. And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allah. But those firm in knowledge say, \"We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord.\" And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19009, "citation_id": 4, "number": 8, "text": "[Who say], \"Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19010, "citation_id": 4, "number": 9, "text": "Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19011, "citation_id": 4, "number": 10, "text": "Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19012, "citation_id": 4, "number": 11, "text": "[Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19013, "citation_id": 4, "number": 12, "text": "Say to those who disbelieve, \"You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19014, "citation_id": 4, "number": 13, "text": "Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met - one fighting in the cause of Allah and another of disbelievers. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19015, "citation_id": 4, "number": 14, "text": "Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19016, "citation_id": 4, "number": 15, "text": "Say, \"Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allah will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allah. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants -", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19017, "citation_id": 4, "number": 16, "text": "Those who say, \"Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19018, "citation_id": 4, "number": 17, "text": "The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allah], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19019, "citation_id": 4, "number": 18, "text": "Allah witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19020, "citation_id": 4, "number": 19, "text": "Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19021, "citation_id": 4, "number": 20, "text": "So if they argue with you, say, \"I have submitted myself to Allah [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me.\" And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, \"Have you submitted yourselves?\" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "2": [ { "id": 19202, "citation_id": 5, "number": 1, "text": "O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allah, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed Allah is ever, over you, an Observer.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19203, "citation_id": 5, "number": 2, "text": "And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19204, "citation_id": 5, "number": 3, "text": "And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19205, "citation_id": 5, "number": 4, "text": "And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19206, "citation_id": 5, "number": 5, "text": "And do not give the weak-minded your property, which Allah has made a means of sustenance for you, but provide for them with it and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19207, "citation_id": 5, "number": 6, "text": "And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is acceptable. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19208, "citation_id": 5, "number": 7, "text": "For men is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, be it little or much - an obligatory share.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19209, "citation_id": 5, "number": 8, "text": "And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of the estate and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19210, "citation_id": 5, "number": 9, "text": "And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19211, "citation_id": 5, "number": 10, "text": "Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19212, "citation_id": 5, "number": 11, "text": "Allah instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19213, "citation_id": 5, "number": 12, "text": "And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for the wives is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from Allah, and Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19214, "citation_id": 5, "number": 13, "text": "These are the limits [set by] Allah, and whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted by Him to gardens [in Paradise] under which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19215, "citation_id": 5, "number": 14, "text": "And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19216, "citation_id": 5, "number": 15, "text": "Those who commit unlawful sexual intercourse of your women - bring against them four [witnesses] from among you. And if they testify, confine the guilty women to houses until death takes them or Allah ordains for them [another] way.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19217, "citation_id": 5, "number": 16, "text": "And the two who commit it among you, dishonor them both. But if they repent and correct themselves, leave them alone. Indeed, Allah is ever Accepting of repentance and Merciful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19218, "citation_id": 5, "number": 17, "text": "The repentance accepted by Allah is only for those who do wrong in ignorance [or carelessness] and then repent soon after. It is those to whom Allah will turn in forgiveness, and Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19219, "citation_id": 5, "number": 18, "text": "But repentance is not [accepted] of those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, \"Indeed, I have repented now,\" or of those who die while they are disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19220, "citation_id": 5, "number": 19, "text": "O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allah makes therein much good.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19221, "citation_id": 5, "number": 20, "text": "But if you want to replace one wife with another and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts], do not take [back] from it anything. Would you take it in injustice and manifest sin?", "translation_id": 5 } ] }, "language": "ENGLISH", "detected_translation": 5, "views": 101, "group": null, "group_link": null, "comments": [ { "id": And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "2": [ { "id": 19202, "citation_id": 5, "number": 1, "text": "O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allah, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed Allah is ever, over you, an Observer.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19203, "citation_id": 5, "number": 2, "text": "And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19204, "citation_id": 5, "number": 3, "text": "And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19205, "citation_id": 5, "number": 4, "text": "And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19206, "citation_id": 5, "number": 5, "text": "And do not give the weak-minded your property, which Allah has made a means of sustenance for you, but provide for them with it and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19207, "citation_id": 5, "number": 6, "text": "And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is acceptable. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19208, "citation_id": 5, "number": 7, "text": "For men is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, be it little or much - an obligatory share.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19209, "citation_id": 5, "number": 8, "text": "And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of the estate and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19210, "citation_id": 5, "number": 9, "text": "And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19211, "citation_id": 5, "number": 10, "text": "Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19212, "citation_id": 5, "number": 11, "text": "Allah instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19213, "citation_id": 5, "number": 12, "text": "And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for the wives is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from Allah, and Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19214, "citation_id": 5, "number": 13, "text": "These are the limits [set by] Allah, and whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted by Him to gardens [in Paradise] under which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19215, "citation_id": 5, "number": 14, "text": "And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19216, "citation_id": 5, "number": 15, "text": "Those who commit unlawful sexual intercourse of your women - bring against them four [witnesses] from among you. And if they testify, confine the guilty women to houses until death takes them or Allah ordains for them [another] way.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19217, "citation_id": 5, "number": 16, "text": "And the two who commit it among you, dishonor them both. But if they repent and correct themselves, leave them alone. Indeed, Allah is ever Accepting of repentance and Merciful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19218, "citation_id": 5, "number": 17, "text": "The repentance accepted by Allah is only for those who do wrong in ignorance [or carelessness] and then repent soon after. It is those to whom Allah will turn in forgiveness, and Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19219, "citation_id": 5, "number": 18, "text": "But repentance is not [accepted] of those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, \"Indeed, I have repented now,\" or of those who die while they are disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19220, "citation_id": 5, "number": 19, "text": "O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allah makes therein much good.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19221, "citation_id": 5, "number": 20, "text": "But if you want to replace one wife with another and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts], do not take [back] from it anything. This surah really stands out for its illustration of how we should interact with Allah, with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and with the rest of society as a whole - so much so that some scholars called it usool ul-adab: the foundation of manners and ethics. 
It starts off defining our relationship with Allah and His Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). 
Then it transitions to our relationship with fellow believers.
Then it transitions to our relationship with society as a whole. 
Finally, it shifts focus to describe our relationship with ourselves.

... May my Lord guide me to the right path

 This ayah is so powerful in describing the process of repentance by starting with a commanding verb 'flee' suggesting to run away and escape from danger, 'to Allah' SW.

Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.", "translation_id": 5 } ] }, "author": { "id": 28, "username": "abdelrahman", "name": "Abdelrahman", "verified": false, "profile_img": null, "followed": false }, "filters": [ { "id": 242, "from": 50, "to": 50, "indicator_text": null } ], "tags": [] }, { "id": 277, "body": "Focus less on quantity, more on quality: I committed myself to reciting a minimum of one page, but whenever I feel like more Ill do more. I wont repeat my mistake of setting a minimum of one juz per night from the start.\r\nDouble up: I read my wird in the morning and then recite the same verses while praying qiyam. Somehow, repeating the same verses twice a day helped me reflect and ponder on them better.\r\nDraw stars: Here is where the pencil magic kicks in! I drew asterisks in the margins of my mushaf to mark the verses that touched me, whether I applied them to my own life or simply enjoyed their meaning or figurative language. The next time I read those verses, their effect on me was much deeper and reflecting on them (or sometimes just being fascinated by them) was much easier! Furthermore, whenever I reached the same page again, I would add more stars. So the page that started with having one star ended up with three or four; the verses that move my heart have now doubled at least, Alhamdulillah!\r\nLook for themes and patterns: Sometimes a certain surah mentions a lot of blessings, for example, or one of Allahs Most Beautiful Names or attributes are repeated many times. I believe this is done to draw our attention to a certain theme so that we will read all the verses in the context of that theme. Sometimes I find themes for the whole surah and sometimes for a page or a group of verses. Whatever it is, I note it down (blessings, Ash-Shakur, etc) in one or two words in the upper margin of the page.", "likes": 2, "draft": false, "published_at": "May 30, 2018 13:17", "room_id": null, "global": true, "editable": false, "deletable": false, "reportable": null, "citation_texts": { "0": [ { "id": 18716, "citation_id": 3, "number": 1, "text": "Alif, Lam, Meem.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18717, "citation_id": 3, "number": 2, "text": "This is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah -", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18718, "citation_id": 3, "number": 3, "text": "Who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them,", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18719, "citation_id": 3, "number": 4, "text": "And who believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18720, "citation_id": 3, "number": 5, "text": "Those are upon [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18721, "citation_id": 3, "number": 6, "text": "Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18722, "citation_id": 3, "number": 7, "text": "Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. And for them is a great punishment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18723, "citation_id": 3, "number": 8, "text": "And of the people are some who say, \"We believe in Allah and the Last Day,\" but they are not believers.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18724, "citation_id": 3, "number": 9, "text": "They [think to] deceive Allah and those who believe, but they deceive not except themselves and perceive [it] not.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18725, "citation_id": 3, "number": 10, "text": "In their hearts is disease, so Allah has increased their disease; and for them is a painful punishment because they [habitually] used to lie.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18726, "citation_id": 3, "number": 11, "text": "And when it is said to them, \"Do not cause corruption on the earth,\" they say, \"We are but reformers.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18727, "citation_id": 3, "number": 12, "text": "Unquestionably, it is they who are the corrupters, but they perceive [it] not.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18728, "citation_id": 3, "number": 13, "text": "And when it is said to them, \"Believe as the people have believed,\" they say, \"Should we believe as the foolish have believed?\" Unquestionably, it is they who are the foolish, but they know [it] not.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18729, "citation_id": 3, "number": 14, "text": "And when they meet those who believe, they say, \"We believe\"; but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, \"Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18730, "citation_id": 3, "number": 15, "text": "[But] Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression [while] they wander blindly.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18731, "citation_id": 3, "number": 16, "text": "Those are the ones who have purchased error [in exchange] for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18732, "citation_id": 3, "number": 17, "text": "Their example is that of one who kindled a fire, but when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness [so] they could not see.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18733, "citation_id": 3, "number": 18, "text": "Deaf, dumb and blind - so they will not return [to the right path].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18734, "citation_id": 3, "number": 19, "text": "Or [it is] like a rainstorm from the sky within which is darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18735, "citation_id": 3, "number": 20, "text": "The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights [the way] for them, they walk therein; but when darkness comes over them, they stand [still]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "1": [ { "id": 19002, "citation_id": 4, "number": 1, "text": "Alif, Lam, Meem.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19003, "citation_id": 4, "number": 2, "text": "Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19004, "citation_id": 4, "number": 3, "text": "He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19005, "citation_id": 4, "number": 4, "text": "Before, as guidance for the people. And He revealed the Qur'an. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah will have a severe punishment, and Allah is exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19006, "citation_id": 4, "number": 5, "text": "Indeed, from Allah nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19007, "citation_id": 4, "number": 6, "text": "It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19008, "citation_id": 4, "number": 7, "text": "It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them]. And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allah. But those firm in knowledge say, \"We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord.\" And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19009, "citation_id": 4, "number": 8, "text": "[Who say], \"Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19010, "citation_id": 4, "number": 9, "text": "Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19011, "citation_id": 4, "number": 10, "text": "Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19012, "citation_id": 4, "number": 11, "text": "[Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19013, "citation_id": 4, "number": 12, "text": "Say to those who disbelieve, \"You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19014, "citation_id": 4, "number": 13, "text": "Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met - one fighting in the cause of Allah and another of disbelievers. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19015, "citation_id": 4, "number": 14, "text": "Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19016, "citation_id": 4, "number": 15, "text": "Say, \"Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allah will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allah. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants -", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19017, "citation_id": 4, "number": 16, "text": "Those who say, \"Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19018, "citation_id": 4, "number": 17, "text": "The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allah], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19019, "citation_id": 4, "number": 18, "text": "Allah witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19020, "citation_id": 4, "number": 19, "text": "Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19021, "citation_id": 4, "number": 20, "text": "So if they argue with you, say, \"I have submitted myself to Allah [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me.\" And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, \"Have you submitted yourselves?\" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "2": [ { "id": 19202, "citation_id": 5, "number": 1, "text": "O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allah, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed Allah is ever, over you, an Observer.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19203, "citation_id": 5, "number": 2, "text": "And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19204, "citation_id": 5, "number": 3, "text": "And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19205, "citation_id": 5, "number": 4, "text": "And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19206, "citation_id": 5, "number": 5, "text": "And do not give the weak-minded your property, which Allah has made a means of sustenance for you, but provide for them with it and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19207, "citation_id": 5, "number": 6, "text": "And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is acceptable. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19208, "citation_id": 5, "number": 7, "text": "For men is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, be it little or much - an obligatory share.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19209, "citation_id": 5, "number": 8, "text": "And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of the estate and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19210, "citation_id": 5, "number": 9, "text": "And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19211, "citation_id": 5, "number": 10, "text": "Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19212, "citation_id": 5, "number": 11, "text": "Allah instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19213, "citation_id": 5, "number": 12, "text": "And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for the wives is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "1": [ { "id": 19002, "citation_id": 4, "number": 1, "text": "Alif, Lam, Meem.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19003, "citation_id": 4, "number": 2, "text": "Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19004, "citation_id": 4, "number": 3, "text": "He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. I wont repeat my mistake of setting a minimum of one juz per night from the start.\r\nDouble up: I read my wird in the morning and then recite the same verses while praying qiyam. Somehow, repeating the same verses twice a day helped me reflect and ponder on them better.\r\nDraw stars: Here is where the pencil magic kicks in! I drew asterisks in the margins of my mushaf to mark the verses that touched me, whether I applied them to my own life or simply enjoyed their meaning or figurative language. The next time I read those verses, their effect on me was much deeper and reflecting on them (or sometimes just being fascinated by them) was much easier! Furthermore, whenever I reached the same page again, I would add more stars. So the page that started with having one star ended up with three or four; the verses that move my heart have now doubled at least, Alhamdulillah!\r\nLook for themes and patterns: Sometimes a certain surah mentions a lot of blessings, for example, or one of Allahs Most Beautiful Names or attributes are repeated many times. I believe this is done to draw our attention to a certain theme so that we will read all the verses in the context of that theme. Sometimes I find themes for the whole surah and sometimes for a page or a group of verses. but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, \"Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18730, "citation_id": 3, "number": 15, "text": "[But] Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression [while] they wander blindly.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18731, "citation_id": 3, "number": 16, "text": "Those are the ones who have purchased error [in exchange] for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18732, "citation_id": 3, "number": 17, "text": "Their example is that of one who kindled a fire, but when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness [so] they could not see.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18733, "citation_id": 3, "number": 18, "text": "Deaf, dumb and blind - so they will not return [to the right path].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18734, "citation_id": 3, "number": 19, "text": "Or [it is] like a rainstorm from the sky within which is darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 18735, "citation_id": 3, "number": 20, "text": "The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights [the way] for them, they walk therein; but when darkness comes over them, they stand [still]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "1": [ { "id": 19002, "citation_id": 4, "number": 1, "text": "Alif, Lam, Meem.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19003, "citation_id": 4, "number": 2, "text": "Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19004, "citation_id": 4, "number": 3, "text": "He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19005, "citation_id": 4, "number": 4, "text": "Before, as guidance for the people. And He revealed the Qur'an. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah will have a severe punishment, and Allah is exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19006, "citation_id": 4, "number": 5, "text": "Indeed, from Allah nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19007, "citation_id": 4, "number": 6, "text": "It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19008, "citation_id": 4, "number": 7, "text": "It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them]. And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allah. But those firm in knowledge say, \"We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord.\" And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19009, "citation_id": 4, "number": 8, "text": "[Who say], \"Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19010, "citation_id": 4, "number": 9, "text": "Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19011, "citation_id": 4, "number": 10, "text": "Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19012, "citation_id": 4, "number": 11, "text": "[Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19013, "citation_id": 4, "number": 12, "text": "Say to those who disbelieve, \"You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place.\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19014, "citation_id": 4, "number": 13, "text": "Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met - one fighting in the cause of Allah and another of disbelievers. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19015, "citation_id": 4, "number": 14, "text": "Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19016, "citation_id": 4, "number": 15, "text": "Say, \"Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allah will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allah. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants -", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19017, "citation_id": 4, "number": 16, "text": "Those who say, \"Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,\"", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19018, "citation_id": 4, "number": 17, "text": "The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allah], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19019, "citation_id": 4, "number": 18, "text": "Allah witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19020, "citation_id": 4, "number": 19, "text": "Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19021, "citation_id": 4, "number": 20, "text": "So if they argue with you, say, \"I have submitted myself to Allah [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me.\" And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, \"Have you submitted yourselves?\" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.", "translation_id": 5 } ], "2": [ { "id": 19202, "citation_id": 5, "number": 1, "text": "O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allah, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed Allah is ever, over you, an Observer.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19203, "citation_id": 5, "number": 2, "text": "And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19204, "citation_id": 5, "number": 3, "text": "And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19205, "citation_id": 5, "number": 4, "text": "And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19206, "citation_id": 5, "number": 5, "text": "And do not give the weak-minded your property, which Allah has made a means of sustenance for you, but provide for them with it and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19207, "citation_id": 5, "number": 6, "text": "And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is acceptable. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19208, "citation_id": 5, "number": 7, "text": "For men is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, be it little or much - an obligatory share.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19209, "citation_id": 5, "number": 8, "text": "And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of the estate and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19210, "citation_id": 5, "number": 9, "text": "And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19211, "citation_id": 5, "number": 10, "text": "Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19212, "citation_id": 5, "number": 11, "text": "Allah instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19213, "citation_id": 5, "number": 12, "text": "And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for the wives is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from Allah, and Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19214, "citation_id": 5, "number": 13, "text": "These are the limits [set by] Allah, and whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted by Him to gardens [in Paradise] under which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19215, "citation_id": 5, "number": 14, "text": "And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19216, "citation_id": 5, "number": 15, "text": "Those who commit unlawful sexual intercourse of your women - bring against them four [witnesses] from among you. And if they testify, confine the guilty women to houses until death takes them or Allah ordains for them [another] way.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19217, "citation_id": 5, "number": 16, "text": "And the two who commit it among you, dishonor them both. But if they repent and correct themselves, leave them alone. Indeed, Allah is ever Accepting of repentance and Merciful.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19218, "citation_id": 5, "number": 17, "text": "The repentance accepted by Allah is only for those who do wrong in ignorance [or carelessness] and then repent soon after. It is those to whom Allah will turn in forgiveness, and Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19219, "citation_id": 5, "number": 18, "text": "But repentance is not [accepted] of those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, \"Indeed, I have repented now,\" or of those who die while they are disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19220, "citation_id": 5, "number": 19, "text": "O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allah makes therein much good.", "translation_id": 5 }, { "id": 19221, "citation_id": 5, "number": 20, "text": "But if you want to replace one wife with another and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts], do not take [back] from it anything. Would you take it in injustice and manifest sin?", "translation_id": 5 } ] }, "language": "ENGLISH", "detected_translation": 5, "views": 101, "group": null, "group_link": null, "comments": [ { "id":
